code.description: An enumerated error code for machine use.

details.description: A human-readable description of the response.

budgetUsagePercent.description: Budget usage percentage (spend / available budget) for the given budget policy.

index.description: An index to maintain order of the portfolioIds

usageUpdatedTimestamp.description: Last evaluation time for budget usage

code.description: An enumerated error code for machine use.

details.description: A human-readable description of the response.

index.description: An index to maintain order of the portfolioIds

error.description: List of budget usage percentages that failed to pull

success.description: List of budget usage percentages that were successfully pulled

portfolios.description: An array of portfolio to create.

CurrencyCode.description:
The currency used for all monetary values for entities under this profile. Cannot be `null`.
|Region|`countryCode`|Country Name|`currencyCode`|
|-----|------|------|------|
|NA|US|United States|USD|
|NA|CA|Canada|CAD|
|NA|MX|Mexico|MXN|
|NA|BR|Brazil|BRL|
|EU|UK|United Kingdom|GBP|
|EU|DE|Germany|EUR|
|EU|FR|France|EUR|
|EU|ES|Spain|EUR|
|EU|IT|Italy|EUR|
|EU|NL|The Netherlands|EUR|
|EU|SE|Sweden|SEK|
|EU|PL|Poland|PLN|
|EU|AE|United Arab Emirates|AED|
|EU|TR|Turkey|TRY|
|FE|JP|Japan|JPY|
|FE|AU|Australia|AUD|
|FE|SG|Singapore|SGD|

ErrorCause.description: Structure describing error cause - location in the payload and data causing error

location.description: Error location, JSON Path expression specifying element of API payload causing error

FeatureState.description: The state for sharing unspent campaign budget.

includeExtendedDataFields.description: whether to get a list of targetingClauses with extended data fields (creationDate, lastUpdateDate, servingStatus).

nextToken.description: token value allowing to navigate to the next response page
token value allowing to navigate to the next response page

ObjectIdFilter.description: Filter entities by the list of objectIds

PolicyType.description: The budget policy. Set to  `DATE_RANGE` to specify a budget for a specific period of time. Set to `MONTHLY_RECURRING` to specify a budget that is automatically renewed at the beginning of each month. To remove budget, set budget `amount`, `startDate`, `endDate` to null and set `policy` to `NO_CAP`.

inBudget.description: States if the portfolio is still within budget.

PortfolioAccessExceptionResponseContent.description: Exception resulting in accessing portfolio entity

endDate.description: The end date after which the budget is no longer applied in ISO 8601.

startDate.description: The starting date to which the budget is applied in ISO 8601.

entityId.description: The entity id in the request

PortfolioEntityQuotaError.description: Errors related to exceeding quota in portfolios service

lastUpdateDateTime.description: Date of last update in ISO 8601.

index.description: the index of the portfolio in the array from the request body

PortfolioMalformedValueError.description:
Errors being used to represent malformed values
e.g. containing not allowed characters, not following patterns etc

fragment.description: fragment of the value which is wrong

PortfolioMissingValueError.description: Error describing missing values in API payloads

PortfolioOtherError.description: Errors not related to any of the other error types

PortfolioRangeError.description: Errors related to range constraints violations

index.description: the index of the portfolio in the array from the request body

portfolios.description: An array of portfolio with updated values.

info.description: This API allows users to do Portfolios management operations.
info.title: Portfolios

parameters.description: The identifier of a client associated with a "Login with Amazon" account.
parameters.name: Amazon-Advertising-API-ClientId

schema.description: The identifier of a client associated with a "Login with Amazon" account.

parameters.description:
The identifier of a profile associated with the advertiser account. Use GET method on Profiles resource to list
profiles associated with the access token passed in the HTTP Authorization header.
parameters.name: Amazon-Advertising-API-Scope

schema.description:
The identifier of a profile associated with the advertiser account. Use GET method on Profiles resource to list
profiles associated with the access token passed in the HTTP Authorization header.

parameters.description:
The "Prefer" header, as defined in [RFC7240], allows clients to request certain behavior from the service.
The service ignores preference values that are either not supported or not known by the service.
Either multiple Prefer headers are passed or single one with comma separated values, both forms are equivalent
Supported preferences:
return=canonicalObjectId - (default) - returns objectIds encoded using canonical representation
return=obfuscatedObjectId - returns obfuscated objectIds
return=representation - return the full object when doing create/update/delete operations instead of ids
parameters.name: Prefer

schema.description:

return=obfuscatedObjectId - returns obfuscated objectIds
return=representation - return the full object when doing create/update/delete operations instead of ids

Preference-Applied.description: Header containing preferences applied while processing API call

schema.description: Header containing preferences applied while processing API call

Retry-After.description: Delay in seconds, before the next re-try attempt to the operation is recommended

schema.description: Delay in seconds, before the next re-try attempt to the operation is recommended

parameters.description: The identifier of a client associated with a "Login with Amazon" account. This is a required header for advertisers and integrators using the Advertising API.
parameters.name: Amazon-Advertising-API-ClientId

parameters.description: The identifier of a profile associated with the advertiser account. Use `GET` method on Profiles resource to list profiles associated with the access token passed in the HTTP Authorization header. This is a required header for advertisers and integrators using the Advertising API.
parameters.name: Amazon-Advertising-API-Scope

207.description: Multi-status. An object containing a list of budget usage response objects reflecting the same order as the input.

401.description: Unauthorized. The request failed because the user is not authenticated or is not allowed to invoke the operation.

403.description: Forbidden. The request failed because user does not have access to a specified resource.

422.description: Unprocessable entity. The server understood the request, but was unable to process the instruction.

429.description: Too Many Requests. The request was rate-limited. Retry later.

500.description: Internal Server BudgetUsageError - Something went wrong on the server. Retry later and report an BudgetUsageError if unresolved.
